term.title: peptides

item.text: Amides derived from two or more amino carboxylic acid molecules (the same or different) by formation of a covalent bond from the carbonyl carbon of one to the nitrogen atom of another with formal loss of water. The term is usually applied to structures formed from α-amino acids, but it includes those derived from any amino carboxylic acid. [image: Not defined] (R may be any organyl group, commonly but not necessarily one found in natural amino acids)
